sentence.content: A ROW has erupted between the Bombay stock exchange, India&apost;s largest stock market, and the Securities and Exchange Board of India, the securities watchdog, over the board&apost;s recent first-ever inspection of stockbrokers&apost; books.

sentence.content: The argument will do nothing to restore investors&apost; faith in the stock market where, as measured by the Bombay stock exchange&apost;s 30-share index, shares have fallen 48 per cent from their peak early last year, including a 320 points fall since the government&apost;s budget was announced two weeks ago.

sentence.content: In one of its most damaging passages, the inspectors&apost; report alleges that D S Prabhoodas, a leading firm headed by Mr Hemendra Kothari, a former BSE president, and by Mr Jaswant Chotalal, a member of the BSE&apost;s governing body, avoided margin payments totalling Rs185.4m (Pounds 4.08m).

sentence.content: Finance ministry officials believe loose regulations allow brokers and others to dodge taxes and also contributed to last year&apost;s securities market scandal in which banks, including the UK&apost;s Standard Chartered Bank, lost a combined gross total of Rs40bn.
